Investigation 2

Proportional Reasoning Using Rate Comparisons

In Investigation 1, we explored strategies for comparing quantities. We used ratios, scaling, proportions, percents, and differences. We also need to be able to recognize when a situation is proportional and which method of comparison is appropriate to solve the problem.
We need two sandwiches for each person at the picnic
I earn $5.50 per hour when I babysit for my neighbor.
A 6-piece serving of chicken nuggets will provide 18 grams of protein.
Akira's top running rate is 8.5 kilometers per hour.

• What is being compared in each statement above?
  • What is the unit of measure for each quantity?

Each statement can be written as a ratio, such as,

  • 5.5 dollars to 1 hour or
  • 18 grams of protein for every 6 pieces of chicken nuggets

Since each ratio is a comparison of two quantities measured in different units, they are called rates.
